an4.100:1.1: Then the wanderer Potaliya went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
an4.100:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and the Buddha said to him:
an4.100:2.1: “Potaliya, these four individuals are found in the world.
an4.100:2.3: One individual criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and correctly. But they don’t praise those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and correctly.
an4.100:2.4: Another individual praises those deserving of praise … But they don’t criticize those deserving of criticism …
an4.100:2.5: Another individual doesn’t praise those deserving of praise … Nor do they criticize those deserving of criticism …
an4.100:2.6: Another individual criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and correctly. And they praise those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and correctly.
an4.100:2.7: These are the four individuals found in the world.
an4.100:2.8: Of these four individuals, who do you believe to be the finest?”
an4.100:3.8: “Mister Gotama, of these four individuals, it is the individual who neither praises those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and correctly; nor criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and correctly.
an4.100:3.9: That is the individual I believe to be the finest.
an4.100:3.11: Because, worthy Gotama, equanimity is the best.”
an4.100:4.3: “Potaliya, of these four individuals, it is the individual who criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and correctly; and praises those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and correctly.
an4.100:4.4: That is the individual I consider to be the finest.
an4.100:4.6: Because, Potaliya, understanding of time and context is the best.”
an4.100:5.3: “Mister Gotama, of these four individuals, it is the individual who criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and correctly; and praises those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and correctly.
an4.100:5.4: That is the individual I believe to be the finest.
an4.100:5.6: Because, worthy Gotama, understanding of time and context is the best.
an4.100:6.2: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with clear eyes can see what’s there, worthy Gotama has made the teaching clear in many ways.
an4.100:6.3: I go for refuge to the worthy Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
an4.100:6.4: From this day forth, may the worthy Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
